<fragment>

Grande was also included in *Pitchfork's* list of "The 200 Most Important Artists of Pitchfork's First 25 Years" for "emerging with music that pushed her artistry further as it asserted a magical trifecta of hope, joy, and a powerhouse voice".[336] Her song "Thank U, Next" was in *Rolling Stone*'s 2021 revision of their 500 Greatest Songs of All Time.[337] In 2023, the magazine included Grande among the 200 Greatest Singers of All Time.[338]


Many recording artists have cited Grande as an influence, including Madison Beer,[339] Sufjan Stevens,[340] Melanie Martinez,[341] Meghan Trainor,[342] Troye Sivan,[343] Jungkook from BTS,[344] Maria Becerra,[345] Billie Eilish,[346] Yeri from Red Velvet,[347] Sabrina Carpenter,[348] Danna Paola,[349] Zara Larsson,[350] Melody,[351] Bryson Tiller,[352] Lana Del Rey,[353] Dove Cameron,[354] Michelle Zauner from Japanese Breakfast,[355] Grace Vanderwaal,[356] Breanna Yde,[357] Maggie Lindemann,[358] Charlie Puth,[359] and Giselle from Aespa.[360]




</fragment>
<fragment>

Having amassed 98 billion streams thus far, Grande is the most streamed female artist as of 2021 and one of the most streamed artists of all time; she is the most streamed female artist of 2010s decade on Spotify and Apple Music.[367][368][369][370][371] Grande is with over 30 billion streams among the top ten of the most streamed artists, being only one of two female artists on the ranking.[372] She became the most streamed female artist on Spotify, surpassing Rihanna, and held the record for over two years, after being overtaken herself.[373] Her songs and albums are some of the most streamed of all time. Grande became the first woman with one and two billion streams with one album,[374] 3.5 billion streams on three separate albums,[375] the first artist to have five albums with four billion streams.[376] She also has ten songs that have overcome one billion streams.[377] As of 2023, she's also the most followed female artist on Spotify.[378]


</fragment>

<fragment>

Bad Bunny and *YHLQMDLG* respectively became Spotify's most-streamed artist and album globally in 2020.[74] It marked the first time a non-English language music artist topped the year-end list,[75] with a *The Guardian* article considering him "the world's biggest pop star" for his streaming numbers.[76] The album received the Grammy Award for Best Latin Pop or Urban Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.[77] On February 20, 2021, Bad Bunny performed "La Noche de Anoche" with Rosalía and "Te Deseo Lo Mejor" on *Saturday Night Live*, hosted by Regé-Jean Page, as well as appearing in the pre-recorded musical sketches "Loco" and "Sea Shanty".[78][79] On the US *Billboard* Hot 100, Bad Bunny's next single "Yonaguni" became his fourth top 10 entry and first with no accompanying acts.[80] Bad Bunny was cast in an upcoming David Leitch-directed film starring Brad Pitt.[81]

**Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio** (born March 10, 1994), known professionally as **Bad Bunny**, is a Puerto Rican rapper and singer.[5] He is known as the "King of Latin Trap".[6][7][3][8] Bad Bunny is the first non-English language act to be Spotify's most streamed artist of the year, and has led the list since 2020.[9] He holds the all-time record for the biggest streaming year of any artist in Spotify history, generating over 18.5 billion streams in 2022.[10]

Bad Bunny and *YHLQMDLG* respectively became Spotify's most-streamed artist and album globally in 2020.[74] It marked the first time a non-English language music artist topped the year-end list,[75] with a *The Guardian* article considering him "the world's biggest pop star" for his streaming numbers.[76] The album received the Grammy Award for Best Latin Pop or Urban Album at the 63rd Annual Grammy Awards.[77] On February 20, 2021, Bad Bunny performed "La Noche de Anoche" with Rosalía and "Te Deseo Lo Mejor" on *Saturday Night Live*, hosted by Regé-Jean Page, as well as appearing in the pre-recorded musical sketches "Loco" and "Sea Shanty".[78][79] On the US *Billboard* Hot 100, Bad Bunny's next single "Yonaguni" became his fourth top 10 entry and first with no accompanying acts.[80] Bad Bunny was cast in an upcoming David Leitch-directed film starring Brad Pitt.[81]

**Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio** (born March 10, 1994), known professionally as **Bad Bunny**, is a Puerto Rican rapper and singer.[5] He is known as the "King of Latin Trap".[6][7][3][8] Bad Bunny is the first non-English language act to be Spotify's most streamed artist of the year, and has led the list since 2020.[9] He holds the all-time record for the biggest streaming year of any artist in Spotify history, generating over 18.5 billion streams in 2022.[10]
